comment.author: 51570155@N04
comment._content: I think this is an old photo from the time when the Manly-Sydney ferries were coal driven, and at the time of big swells when crossing that strech of water near the heads, because they didn't have the modern power of diesel engines, they used to at times for safety reasons they used zig-sag in that strech of water, given the fact that she has nothing at all coming from her funnells that they used to produce vast clouds of black smoke, suggests to me she has in fact has her engines closed down and her helm hard to stabord on her way to the Quay.

comment.author: 37494672@N06
comment._content: I believe this is the ferry Curl Curl, on which I had much fun in the 1950s.

comment.author: 57407120@N07
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/oz_neville] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/oz_neville] 
Hmmmmmm No way she is shut down. She would be at Full Ahead ploughing through this sea across the heads. No where near the Quay in this shot.
These ships were built to travel Beam On (Side On) across the Heads and this one sailed from Scotland under her own steam.
